name: CHICKEN CAESAR SALAD
directions:
1. Marinate chicken fillet for 20min with the Dry Spices, Dahi and Lemon Juice
2. After grilling chicken. Cut it into bite-size cubes.
3. Make a dressing using olives, parmesan cheese, Mustard Sauce.(Add Dahi and Lemon if you like)
4. Assemble all the INGRIDIENTS in a bowl.
5. Add lettuce, chicken, and dressing on top.
6. Mix well and Enjoy! "

name: PANCAKES
directions:
1. Add Banana, White oats, Peanut Butter,Hot water, Egg, and Vanilla Essence to the Blender. Make a Mixture!
2. Now Make Pancakes on a Non-Stick Pan
3. Drizzle with Honey on Top!!

name: RAJMA CHAWAL
directions:
1. For Rice: Toast the basmati in a little cooking spray over medium heat, add water, bring to a boil, add salt, and cook on a simmer for about 20 minutes, until water is evaporated/absorbed, cover, and let sit for five minutes.
2. For the rajma: brown the onions in the oil over medium heat, add the garlic and tomatoes and cook until a thick paste-like consistency, about 10 minutes. Add salt and pepper (to taste) and channa masala, if using. Add in two cans of kidney beans (if you drain them, make sure you add water back in so there's 'sauce'). Bring to a boil and simmer until ready to serve!
3. Add ginger to the rajma. Or add fresh herbs.
4. Makes 2 servings!

name: MINI PIZZA
directions:
1. Spread Chilli Garlic Sauce over the pitta bread
2. Now add the chicken and grated cheese
3. Garish with Olives and Chopped Capsicum
4. Sprinkle some oregano for better taste
5. Bake/Pan Cook/Airfry till cheese melts

name: FISH AND CHIPS
directions:
1. Marinate fish with spices of your choice. You can add different herbs, Red Chilli powder, salt, 1.5 tsp each of soya sauce, and Bbq Sauce. Just pan-fry on low flame / Airfry/Bake.
2. For fries, Cut Potatoes, Add oregano, other available herbs, a pinch of chicken powder, Red Chilli Powder, red chili flakes. Air fry/Bake.

name: CHICKEN STEAK
directions:
1. For grilled cjicken in abowl add red chilli powder, salt, blacl pepper powder, ginger garlic paste, dried coriander, soya sauce, and vinegar and mix well.
2. Hammer the Chicken Fillet and Add chicken fillets, mix well and marinate for 1 hour.
3. In a grill pan/pan add cooking oil (slight quantity) and marinated chicken fillets, grill on low flame from both sides (approx 4-5 minutes on each side)
4. For Sauce:In a saucepan add 1 tbsp butter and let it melt.
5. Add chopped onions, and garlic and mix well.
6. Then add 1 tbsp of maida ( all-purpose flour) and mix well for 1 minute.
7. Next add soya sauce, black pepper powder, salt, chili garlic sauce, and mix it (You can also add lemon juice/Chipotle sauce)
8. Add chicken stock, whisk until well combined, and cook for 2-3 minutes or until sauce thickens and set aside.
9. For Vegetables: In a Pan add green onion leaves and mix well.
10. Then Corriander leaves and mix.
11. Next add carrots, capsicum, salt, black pepper
12. Assemble the steak and enjoy

name: ALO KA PARATHA WITH GREEN CHUTNEY
directions:
1. For Paratha use Whole Wheat Flour and water to knead the dough
2. Boil potatoes
3. Add chopped onion and all the spices according to your taste! Cook the Paratha!
4. For Green Chutney Add Yoghurt, Green Chilli, Coriander Leaves, Salt, and Cumin Seeds in a blender
5. You can also store it for future use

name: GRILLED FISH
directions:
1. In fish, add red chili crushed, carom seeds, salt, coriander seeds, red chili powder, black pepper crushed, ginger garlic paste, and lemon juice, mix well & marinate for 1 hour.
2. In the grill pan, add butter and let it melt, add garlic and mix well. Add marinated fish and cook on low flame until done (3-4 minutes on each side). -Sprinkle chaat masala, lemon juice & sevanned

name: CHICKEN YAKHNI
directions:
1. In a pot, add cooking oil & heat it.
2. Add desi chicken & mix well until it changes colour.
3. Add ginger, and garlic, mix well & cook for a minute.
4. Add onion, bay leaf, cinnamon sticks, black peppercorns, cloves, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, fennel seeds, green cardamom, black pepper crushed, salt, fresh turmeric, chicken cubes & mix well.
5. Add water and mix well, bring it to boil, and remove scum then cover & a on medium flame until chicken
is tender and stock is reduced to half (appi 1.5 hours).
6. Now strain the stock with the help of the strainer, reserve the chicken serving & discard the leftovers.
7. In a serving bowl, add boiled chicken and prepared stock.
8. Garnish with boiled egg, sprinkle black pepper crushed & serve hot! 
9. Makes 2 servings!

name: CHICKEN PULAO
directions:
1.In a pot, add olive oil.
2. Add black peppercorns, cloves, cinnamon sticks, bay leaves, black Protein 100gm cardamom, cumin seeds, curry leaves & mix well.
3. Add onion, mix well & fry until lightly golden.
4. Add chicken mix boti & mix well until it changes colour.
5. Add ginger garlic paste, tomatoes, green chilli paste, mix well cook for 2 minutes.
6. Add coriander powder, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, fennel powder, salt, cumin powder, nutmeg powder & mace powder, mix well and cook for 1-2 minutes.
7. Add yoghurt, mix well & cook for a minute, cover & cook on low flame for 8-10 minutes then cook on high flame until oil separates. Add rice & mix & Add hot water & mix well.
8. Add green chillies, coriander seeds, fennel seeds, lemon juice, mix well & bring it to boil, cover & cook on low flame for 5-6 minutes.
9. Add fried onion, cover & steam cook on low flame for 10-12 minutes.
10. Serve chicken pulao with yogurt, salad & pickle.

name: CHICKEN MANCHURIAN WITH RICE
directions:
1. Boil 75 g Raw Rice
2. In a Pan, Add Oil and Chicken. Cook the chicken on low flame till golden brown
3. Meanwhile, in a bowl take 1 Total Carbohydrate 73 g cup water, add cornflour, chili sauce, soy sauce, and mix well
4. Now add cubed onions and capsicum to the chicken and saute!
5. Now add Chilli Garlic Sauce and the Cornflour Mixture in the Chicken!
6. Let it simmer! Add Salt and pepper according to taste
7. Serve with Rice!!

name: CHICKEN BURGER
directions:
1. Marinate Chicken Breast with Spices/Tikka Masala
2. Grill/BBQ/STEAM/AIR FRY Chicken using 0.5 tbsp Oil
3. Place your Cheese slide at the end so it Melts
4. Toast Your Buns, apply mustard sauce and place your cheese and chicken (Use tomato/onion slices if like)

name: QEEMA ROTI
directions:
1. Add QEEMA in the pan with onions until browned.
2. Add tomatoes, peas, and spices along with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Bring to a simmer and cook for 25 minutes.
4. Add water if it becomes too thick.
5. Serve with one  7” roti

name: PIZZA OMELETTE
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Start by making the crust. Crack eggs into a bowl and add the rest of the INGRIDIENTS. Add only 50 grams of cheese. Give a good stir
3. Line a pie plate or any other oven-proof dish, with parchment paper Pour in the pizza crust batter. Spread it out evenly with a spatula. Bake in the oven for 15 minutes until the pizza crust turns golden.
4. Spread tomato sauce on the crust.Top with remaining cheese
5. Bake for another 10 minutes or until the pizza has turned a golden brown color.
6. Sprinkle with oregano and serve.

name: CHICKEN BIRYANI
directions:
1. Fry Onions in Oil, Separate the Onions from oil & Blend with Tomatoes
2. In same Oil, Add Shan Masala, Chicken, Blended Onions and Tomatoes, Green Chillies and Yogurt
3. Cook till the Chicken is Soft.
4. Layer the Gravy & Rice
5. Cook on low flame for 10-15 Mins
6. Serve with salad and Green Chutney!

name: FRIED EGG AND BREAD
directions:
1. Toast a slice of bread in a toaster or on a pan until golden.
2. Heat 1 tbsp of oil or butter in a pan over medium heat.
3. Crack the egg into the pan, season with salt and pepper, and cook until the white is set.
4. Place the fried egg on the toasted bread and serve!

name: CHICKEN AND RED BEAN SALAD
directions:
1. Take 1 cup Boiled Beans in a Bowl
2. Add Freshly grilled Chicken to the bowl.
3. Add the Sliced Vegetable in the Bowl.
4. Add Lemon Juice and Spices according to Taste

name: TALBINA
directions:
1. In the bowl, add broken barley and wash with water.
2. Add water and soak for 3-4 hours or overnight then drain the water.
3. In a pot, add milk and bring it to boil, add soaked barley and mix well, cover partially and cook on low for 8-10 minutes.
4. Deseed and chop dates.
5. Add dates, mix well, cover partially and cook on low flame for 25-30 minutes.
6. Add cardamom powder and mix well, cover partially and cook for another for 8-10 minutes.
7. Add pistachio, almonds and mix well.
8. Garnish & serve!

name: CHICKEN HALEEM WITH ROTI
directions:
1. In a pot, add water, barley, wheat and bring it to a boil, let it simmer for 30 minutes.
2. Add baking soda, cover, and cook till tender (approximately: 1 & ½ hours).
3. In a wok, add oil, ginger garlic paste, boneless chicken, fry until it changes color.
4. Add red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, green chili, salt, yogurt, and cook until chicken is done.
5. Add fried onion, mix well, shred the cooked chicken and set aside.
6. Blend barley and wheat mixture until smooth, add cooked chicken and chicken cube s mix until well combined.
7. Add salt and boiled water if haleem is too thick (optional) and blend again.
8. Add whole spice powder, nutmeg & mace powder, and chaat masala.
9. In a frying pan, add a bit of oil and onion, fry until golden brown, add fried onion haleem mixture and mix well.
10. For garnishing, add fried onion, green chili, green coriander, ginger, chaat masala, lemon juice.
11. Serve with one 7” roti/chapati.

name: DAAL WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Rinse lentils and soak them in water for 2 hours.
2. Drain and transfer to a saucepan and add water, salt, and turmeric.
3. Bring to boil, reduce heat, cover, and cook for 20 minutes, until lentils are tender.
4. Add finely chopped onion and stir well.
5. Cook until the mixture has thickened.
6. Heat Desi ghee in a small frying pan, add cumin seeds, cloves, and crushed garlic.
7. Stir-fry for a few minutes until the seeds pop and garlic is golden brown.
8. Pour into lentils and stir well.
9. Serve with one 7” Roti

name: PALAK PANEER WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Heat the oil and fry the cubed paneer until
2. light brown. Keep aside.
3. Boil the spinach with garlic. Drain and blend to make a puree
4. Add the onions to the heated oil. Sauté till light brown. Add the spices, ginger, spinach puree, and salt to taste and cook for 5 to 6 minutes.
5. Finally add the fried cheese cubes.
6. Serve with one 7” roti

name: BEEF CHAPLI KABAB WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Spray a small pan with cooking oil. Pour 2 egg whites and cook till done
2. Combine scrambled egg, beef, chopped tomato, onion, mint, ginger-garlic paste, coriander seeds, salt, cumin, & red pepper in a bowl. Mix by hand until well combined. 
3. Shape mixture into patties.
4. Press a tomato slice into the center of each patty.
5. Heat 2 Tbsp Oil in a Nonstick Pan and Cook Patties till Golden Brown
6. Serve with one 7” roti.

name: PANJIRI
directions:
1. Dry roast Sooji in a pan.
2. Dry roast Whole Wheat in a pan.
3. In a pan, add Cashew Nut, Almonds, Melon Seeds, Desiccated Coconut, Flax Seeds, Poppy Seeds, dry roast it and cool down. Grind roasted nuts and seeds into powder.
4. In a bowl add roasted Sooji, Whole Wheat and powdered roasted Nuts and Seeds.
5. Add Coconut Oil and melted Jaggery, mix well without lumps.
6. Serve it in a bowl.

name: CURRY PAKORA WITH ROTI
directions:
1. In a mixing bowl, add 0.33 cups of curd, 0.17 cups of besan, 0.33 teaspoons of turmeric, and 0.33 teaspoons of red chilli powder.
2.  Add chopped green chilli and coriander, and 0.17 cups (a bit more than 1/8 cup) of water. Whisk well to avoid lumps.
3. Heat 0.33 teaspoons of oil in a pan, add cumin and coriander seeds, and let them crackle. Add red chillies, chopped green chilli, and sauté.
4. Gradually add the curd mixture, stirring continuously to avoid any lumps. Add 0.33 cups of water and let it boil on low flame. Cook for at least 20 minutes and add 0.17 teaspoons of garam masala.
5. Add the baked pakoras to the kadhi, mix well, check seasoning, and finish with chopped coriander.

Baked Pakoras for 1 Serving

1. Preheat the oven to 200°C. Grease the baking tray with a little oil.
2. In a mixing bowl, add 0.33 cups of besan, 0.33 tablespoons of ginger garlic paste, 0.67 chopped green chilli, 0.33 teaspoons of red chilli powder, 0.17 teaspoons of turmeric, and 0.17 teaspoons of garam masala.
3. Add chopped coriander leaves, 0.11 pieces of sliced onion, and a pinch of baking powder. Mix well.
4. Add 0.17 cups (a bit more than 1/8 cup) of water and mix to avoid lumps.
5. Scoop a tablespoon of batter onto the greased tray, evenly spaced.
6. Bake for 9-10 minutes, flipping halfway through to bake evenly. Bake until golden on both sides. If needed, drizzle a little oil.
7. Once the pakoras are crispy, take them out of the oven.

name: BOILED BROWN RICE
directions:
1. In a bowl, add Water, Brown Rice and soak for 30 min.
2. In a heavy bottom vessel, add Water, Salt, Rice and cook till soft.
3. Strain the Rice, remove to a container and keep aside.

name: EGG AND PARATHA
directions:
1. In a bowl, add some Flour, Curd, Salt and Oil and mix well.
2. Add some Water and knead into a smooth dough.
3. Rest dough for 30 mins and cut into small portions.
4. Roll out dough portions on a floured surface to a 8 inch diameter.
5. Coat Oil on the flat dough and sprinkle some Atta.
6. Cut strips with a cutter.
7. Fold them together and twist into a knot. The Paratha will be like a stack of folds. Rest the folded Paratha for 30 mins in a cool area.
8. Once rested, flour a work surface and roll out the Paratha to a diameter of 8.5 inches.
9. Sprinkle additional Flour while rolling if needed. Use minimum pressure while rolling to have maximum visibility of the layers once cooked.
10. Cook on a hot griddle till Golden Brown. Remove to a plate when done.
11. Heat 1 tbsp of oil or butter in a pan over medium heat.
12. 3. Crack the egg into the pan, season with salt and pepper, and cook until the white is set.
13. 4. Place the fried egg on the toasted bread and serve!

name: CHICKEN CURRY WITH ROTI
directions:
1. In a heavy bottom vessel, add Water, Chicken Bones bring to boil. Drain the Water, wash the Bone and keep aside.
2. In a heavy bottom vessel add Water, boiled Chicken Bones, Coriander Roots, roughly cut Onion, Ginger, Garlic and simmer for 3 hours. Strain the stock to a bowl and keep aside.
3. Heat Oil in a pan. Add Ginger Garlic Paste and saute till fragrant.
4. Add chopped Onion, Salt and saute till Golden Brown.
5. Add Turmeric Powder, Kashmiri Red Chilli Powder and cook for a minute.
6. Add chopped Tomatoes and cook till mushy.
7. In a heavy bottom vessel, add Water, Broken Cashew Nuts, Magaz bring to boil and drain the water and keep aside.
8. Heat Oil in a pan. Add Bay Leaf, Black Cardamom. Saute.
9. Add sliced Onion and saute till Golden Brown.
10. Add boiled Cashew and Magaz and saute.
11. Add Water and bring to boil.
12. Remove to a blender and make a paste.
13. In a bowl, add Ginger Garlic Paste, Red Chilli Powder, Turmeric Powder, Salt, cubed Chicken Breasts. Mix well and keep aside to marinate.
14. Heat Oil in a pan. Add Green Cardamom, Black Cardamom, Cinnamon Stick, Peppercorn, Bay Leaves.
15. Add Mustard Seeds and saute. Allow to crackle.
16. Add Curry Leaves, chopped Garlic and chopped Green Chilli and saute till Golden Brown.
17. Add Ginger Garlic Paste and saute till Golden Brown.
18. Add Garam Masala, Cumin Powder, Coriander Powder, Kashmiri Red Chilli Powder, Turmeric Powder and saute for some time.
19. Add Tomato Puree, Onion Tomato Masala, Besan, Cashew Magaz Paste and cook till oil separates from Masala.
20. Add marinated Chicken cubes and saute.
21. Add Chicken Stock , Salt and bring to boil.
22. Add Vinegar, Jaggery and mix well.
23. Remove to a bowl and garnish with chopped Coriander.
24. Serve with hot roti.

name: MOONG DAL KHICHDI
directions:
1. Wash and soak 0.25 cups of rice and 0.25 cups of dal separately for 30 minutes. Chop 1 green chilli and set aside. Heat 0.75 tablespoons of oil in a vessel.
2. Add 0.5 teaspoons of cumin seeds and let them splutter.
3. Add the chopped green chilli and sauté.
4. Add 5 grams of ginger-garlic paste. Sauté until the raw flavor goes away.
5. Once the raw flavor of the ginger-garlic paste is gone, add the powdered spices (0.5 teaspoons each of turmeric and red chilli powder) along with 1 chopped tomato. Sauté until the masalas are cooked through and the tomato softens.
6. Add the soaked rice and dal. Add water (approximately 1.5 cups) and 0.5 teaspoons of salt. Mix and cover with the lid.
7. Cook until done (the dal and rice should be mashed together but still have a slight bite). Check the seasoning and mix in the chopped coriander, leaving a little for garnish.
8. Garnish with the remaining chopped coriander and serve hot.

name: PUNJABI DAL TARKA WITH RICE
directions:
1. Boil Arhar Dal and keep aside.
2. Boil Chana dal and keep aside.
3. Boil Green Moong Dal split and keep aside.
4. In a pan heat Oil then add Cumin Seed and let it crackle.
5. Add chopped Garlic, chopped Onion, chopped Tomato and cook it well.
6. Add chopped Ginger, Green Chilli, Hing, Turmeric Powder, Red Chilli Powder, Cumin Powder, Coriander Powder.
7. Add boiled Dal & Lemon Juice. Check consistency by adding Water.
8. Serve in a bowl. Garnish with chopped Coriander.

name: ALOO BAINGAN WITH RICE
directions:
1. Boil diced Potato with Turmeric and Salt. Drain and keep aside.
2. Cut Brinjal in cubes and keep in salted water.
3. Put Oil in a pan, add Cumin Seeds, Kaloonji, Hing and let it crackle.
4. Add chopped Ginger, Garlic, Green Chilli and sauté till Golden Brown.
5. Add chopped Onion and sauté till Golden Brown.
6. Add Cumin Powder, Turmeric Powder, Coriander Powder, Red Chilli Powder and Chat Masala. Cook it further.
7. Add cut Brinjal and cook till half cooked. Add water if required.
8. Add chopped Tomatos and cook till mushy.
9. Add Potato and then mix well.
10. Adjust seasoning and garnish with Coriander Leaves.

name: ALOO GOBI WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Heat 2 tablespoons (30 mL) of water in a large pot.
2. Add the 1/6 of chopped onion and cook over medium-high heat for about 3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the onion begins to soften.
3. Reduce the heat to medium. Add the chopped 1/3 of a potato and 1/2 cup of cauliflower. Continue cooking, stirring often, for about 5 minutes. Add water, 1 tablespoon at a time, if needed to prevent sticking.
4. In a separate dry skillet over medium heat, toast the cumin seeds, turmeric, coriander, ginger, cinnamon, and cayenne for about 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
5. Add the toasted spices to the vegetables along with 1/4 cup of tomatoes and a pinch of salt. Stir to mix, then cover and simmer for about 20 minutes until flavors are blended.

name: KARAHI QEEMA WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Heat Oil: Begin by heating 1 tablespoon of olive oil in your pan or pot.
2. Sauté Aromatics: Add the chopped onion, 1/2 tablespoon of ginger-garlic paste, and sauté until golden brown.
3. Brown the Minced Chicken: Add the 100 grams of chicken mince and cook until it browns.
4. Add Spices and Water: Add all the spices (1/4 tbsp red chili crushed, 1/4 tbsp red chili powder, a pinch of turmeric, 1/8 tbsp coriander powder, 1-2 black peppercorns, a pinch of cumin, 1 curry leaf, 1 whole red chili, 1/16 tbsp kalonji, salt to taste, and 1/2 tbsp qeema masala) and 1/8 cup (about 2 tablespoons) of water. Bring to a boil, then allow to simmer.
5. Simmer: Cook the meat on medium heat for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally until it is halfway done. Then, add 1/2 chopped tomato.
6. Cook Until Done**: Continue to simmer until the water evaporates and the oil starts to separate from the curry. Stir frequently to prevent burning.
7. Adjust Consistency: Once the water has mostly evaporated and the curry is at your desired consistency, turn off the heat.
8. Garnish: Garnish with julienned ginger, chopped green chili, and a sprinkle of chopped coriander (optional).
9. Serve with one 7 inch roti

name: CHICKEN HANDI WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Mix about 1.5 teaspoons of Shan Chicken Handi Mix in the yogurt and apply it to the chicken cubes. Marinate for 30 minutes.
2. Boil a small tomato (80-85 grams) in ¼ cup of water until soft and tender. Sieve to remove skin and seeds, and set the puree aside.
3. Separately, boil 25 grams of onion in ¼ cup of water and grind to a paste. Sieve and keep aside.
4. In hot oil (1 tablespoon), add the marinated chicken and stir-fry for 5 minutes.
5. Add the tomato puree and onion paste to the chicken. Cover and cook on low heat for 10-15 minutes until the chicken is fully cooked.
6. Stir in 2 teaspoons of butter, 1 teaspoon of chopped coriander, and 1.5 tablespoons of single cream. Stir for 1 minute and remove from heat.
7. Serve with one 7 inch roti.

name: FRIED CHOPS
directions:
1. Apply about 2 teaspoons of Shan Fried Chops Mix to 400 grams of chops. Beat and flatten the meat slightly if necessary.
2. Leave the marinated chops aside for 2 hours to allow the flavors to infuse.
3. Heat 3 tablespoons of oil in a pot.
4. Add the marinated chops to the hot oil. Stir-fry for a few minutes to get a good sear on the outside.
5. Cover the pot and cook on low heat for 10 to 15 minutes until the chops are fully cooked and tender.
6. Serve hot and enjoy.

name: NIHARI WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a pot, add the meat and 2 teaspoons of Shan Nihari Mix. Stir-fry until the oil separates from the masala.
2. Add 3 cups of water and 330 grams of bones (knuckle & marrow). Stir and bring to a boil. Cover and cook undisturbed on low heat:
o Beef: 6 hours
o Goat/Lamb: 4 hours
o Chicken: 3 hours
3. Once cooked, remove the bones, collect the marrow, and discard the bones. Add the marrow back into the gravy.
4. Gradually add the dissolved flour (2.5 tablespoons flour in 40 ml water) to the gravy. Stir and mix. Bring to a boil and cook for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Heat the remaining oil (1.5 tablespoons) and fry the sliced onion (12-13 grams) until golden brown. Pour the fried onion and oil mixture into the Nihari. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes on low heat.
6. Serve with one 7 inch roti

name: CHICKEN KORMA WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a pot and fry the onion (50 grams) until light golden. Remove the onions and crush them.
2. In the same oil, add the chicken meat (170 grams), yogurt (50 grams), and 2 teaspoons of Shan Korma Mix. Cover and cook on low heat for 20-30 minutes.
3. Add julienne ginger (½-1 teaspoon) and 80 ml of water for gravy. Cover and cook on low heat until the meat is tender.
4. Stir in the crushed onions. Cover and cook on low heat for an additional 5-10 minutes.
5. Serve hot and with one 7 inch roti and enjoy!

name: KHAO SUEY
directions:
1. Drizzle 1 tablespoon of cooking oil into a pan and add the chopped onions. Stir well.
2. Add ginger paste and cook, stirring continuously for a minute. Add the chicken (60 grams) and stir-fry for 7–8 minutes.
3. Add Shan Chicken Masala, turmeric, and cook for a further 2 minutes. Add the besan (½ tablespoon) and mix well.
4. Pour in chicken stock (½ cup) and mix. Add coconut milk (¼ cup), bring to a simmer, and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes.
5. In a separate pan, heat oil and fry the roti (cut into small rectangular pieces) until golden and crispy.
6. In another pan, boil the noodles (60 grams) according to package instructions, drain, and set aside.
7. Assemble the dish: Place noodles on a plate, top with cucumbers, roasted peanuts, fried onions, fried flour roti, green chili, and finally the chicken gravy mixture.
8. Serve hot and enjoy!

name: CHICKEN MASALA WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Heat 3 tablespoons of oil in a pan and add the chopped onions. Fry until golden brown.
2. Remove the fried onions and crush them.
3. Add the chicken (250 grams) into the same oil and cook for 7-8 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the yogurt (75 grams) and Shan Chicken Masala Mix (1 teaspoon). Stir to combine.
5. Cook for 20-30 minutes, allowing the chicken to absorb the spices and become tender.
6. Add julienned ginger (½ tablespoon) and 1 to 2 cups of water. Stir and cover the pot.
7. Cook for an additional 5 minutes, then add the crushed onions back in.
8. Stir, cover, and cook for another 5 minutes.
9. Serve hot with one 7 inch roti.

name: SHAKSHOUKA WITH WHITE BREAD
directions:
1. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a pan. Add the chopped onion, red bell pepper, and minced garlic. Stir and cook for 3-4 minutes until the vegetables soften.
2. Add the tomato puree (1/3 cup or 75 grams) and mix well. Stir in the Shan Nihari Masala (2 teaspoons). Allow it to cook on low flame for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. Make a small space in the mixture and carefully crack the egg into it.
4. Allow the egg to cook in the sauce. You can cover the pan with a lid and cook for 4-5 minutes to help the egg cook through (or longer if you prefer a firmer yolk).
5. Once the egg is cooked to your liking, sprinkle some chopped parsley (optional).
6. Serve hot with 2 slices of white bread and enjoy!

name: CHICKEN BROAST
directions:
1. Add 2 tablespoons of water to a pot and add the chicken pieces. Boil for 5 minutes to par-cook the chicken, then drain the water.
2. Evenly coat the chicken pieces with 2 tablespoons of Shan Chicken Broast Mix. Refrigerate for 10 minutes to let the spices marinate.
3. Heat 3/4 cup of oil in a deep pan or frying pot. Once hot, add the marinated chicken.
4. Deep fry on medium heat until the chicken is golden and crispy, approximately 7-10 minutes, depending on the size of the chicken pieces.
5. Remove and let excess oil drain. Serve hot and enjoy!

name: SHAMI KABAB WITH BROWN RICE
directions:
1. In a small pot, cook 125 grams of meat with 25 grams of daal chana, 1/3 chopped onion, 1/4 teaspoon ginger paste, 1/2 teaspoon garlic paste, and 2 teaspoons of Shan Shami Kabab Mix. Add 1 - 1.25 cups of water.
2. Bring the mixture to a boil, then cover and cook on low heat for 25-30 minutes, until the meat is tender and water is reduced to about 1/4 cup.
3. Remove from heat, let it cool slightly, and then coarsely grind the mixture using a food processor or grinder.
4. Add 1 tablespoon of whisked egg to the mixture and knead well.
5. Form the mixture into 2-3 small round flat patties.
6. Heat 2-3 tablespoons of oil in a pan. Shallow fry the kababs on medium heat for about 2-3 minutes on each side until they are crispy golden.
7. Remove from oil, drain excess oil on a paper towel.
8. Serve hot with brown rice.

name: BOMBAY BIRYANI
directions:
1. For the Meat Curry:
o Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a pan. Fry 33 grams of chopped onions until golden.
o Add 50 grams of diced tomatoes and cook until the oil separates from the mixture.
o Add 165 grams of meat, 1/2 tablespoon of ginger & garlic paste, 1/2 tablespoon of yogurt, 40 grams of diced potatoes, and 2 teaspoons of Shan Special Bombay Biryani Mix. Stir fry on medium heat for 5-6 minutes.
o Add 1/2 to 1 cup of water (depending on the meat type) and cover. Cook on low heat:
 Chicken: 15-20 minutes
 Beef/Mutton: 30-35 minutes
o Once meat is tender, increase the heat and stir fry until oil separates from the gravy.
2. For the Rice:
o Boil 2 1/2 cups of water with a pinch of salt. Add 125 grams of soaked Basmati rice. Boil the rice until 75% cooked (approximately 7-8 minutes), then drain thoroughly.
3. Layering the Biryani:
o Spread half the cooked rice in a small pot.
o Pour the prepared meat curry on top of the rice layer.
o Add the remaining rice over the meat curry. Cover and cook on low heat for 5 minutes until the rice is fully cooked.
o Mix gently before serving.

name: SAFAID CHANNAY CHAWAL
directions:
1. Sauté the chopped onions in 1/2 tbsp of canola oil on medium heat until caramelized.
2. Add 1/4 tsp of cumin seeds and cook until fragrant.
3. Add 1 cup of chickpeas, 1/4 tsp salt, and 3/4 tsp red or cayenne pepper. Heat the mixture thoroughly.
4. Garnish with fresh diced tomato and onion if desired.
5. Serve with white basmati rice.

name: SAFAID CHAWAL
ROGAN JOSH WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Finely chop the onion, ginger, and garlic, then blend them into a paste using a grinder.
2. Heat 1/2 to 3/4 tablespoon of olive oil in a saucepan. Once hot, add the chopped green chili and the onion-ginger-garlic paste. Cook until the paste begins to release oil.
3. Add the diced lamb pieces and brown them over high heat, stirring frequently until fully browned.
4. Add 25 grams of chopped tomatoes, cooking until they are fully incorporated. If the sauce begins to stick, add a splash of water.
5. Add the turmeric, garam masala, ground coriander, chili powder, and salt. Cook until the sauce is smooth.
6. Mix in 3/4 tablespoon of plain yoghurt, cover with a lid, and simmer for about 20 minutes or until the lamb is tender.
7. Adjust the salt and chili as needed. If you prefer a thicker sauce, continue cooking to reduce it or add a little water to thin it out.
8. Serve with one 7 inch roti.

name: MOONG DAL WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Wash 2 tablespoons of yellow lentils well, then add 1/4 cup of water. 
2. Cook the lentils in a pressure cooker until they are tender.
3. In a pan, heat a small amount of oil. Once hot, add 1/8 teaspoon each of mustard and cumin seeds until they splutter.
4. Add the cooked lentils to the pan along with an additional 1/4 cup of water, salt, and chopped green chilies. Boil for about 5 minutes.
5. Turn off the heat, then add the lemon juice and chopped cilantro. Mix well.
6. Serve with one 7 inch roti.

name: MIXED SABZI WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Cook 1/4 cup of brown rice according to the package instructions. Once done, set aside and keep warm.
2. Steam 1/2 cup of cauliflower for about 5 minutes until slightly tender.
3. In a large skillet, sauté 1/8 of a medium onion, 1/2 diced baby carrot, and 1 minced garlic clove until tender.
4. Stir in 1/8 teaspoon of ground ginger, 1/2 tablespoon of curry powder, 1/8 teaspoon of salt, and 1/8 teaspoon of ground cloves.
5. Add 1/4 cup of drained and rinsed chickpeas, 1/4 cup of canned diced tomatoes (with liquid), 2 tablespoons of frozen peas, and the steamed cauliflower. Cook and stir for about 5 minutes until everything is heated through.
6. Remove from heat.
7. Serve with one 7 inch roti. Enjoy!

name: DAHI CHICKEN CURRY WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Heat oil in a thick-bottomed pan and sauté the cardamom pods, peppercorns, bay leaf, cinnamon stick, and cloves until they begin to sizzle.
2. Add onions and green chillies, and fry for 3-5 minutes on medium-high heat until the onions turn pink and tender.
3. Add the ginger-garlic paste and sauté for another 1-2 minutes until it gives out oil.
4. Stir in the red chilli powder, cumin powder, turmeric, coriander powder, and garam masala, and fry for 1 minute.
5. Add the chopped tomato and salt, cooking until the tomatoes turn into a pulp and release oil around the sides of the pan.
6. Gradually add the beaten yoghurt, mixing to form a smooth gravy base.
7. Add the chicken pieces and water if needed, then cook covered for 10-15 minutes on medium-low heat until the chicken is cooked through.
8. Garnish with fresh chopped coriander leaves.
9.  Serve hot with one 7 inch roti.

name: MASOOR DAL CHAWAL
directions:
1. Rinse the lentils thoroughly.
2. Place the lentils in a small pot with 1 cup of water. Add minced jalapeno, turmeric, and salt to taste.
3. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the lentils are soft.
4. In a non-stick frying pan, melt the butter. Add the sliced onion and sauté over medium-low heat until the onions are very soft and brown.
5. Top the cooked lentils with the sautéed onion.
6. Serve with rice.

name: PALAK CHAWAL
directions:
1. Prepare Ginger-Garlic Paste: Grind equal quantities of ginger and garlic to a paste. Use 1/4 tsp of this paste for the curry.
2. Blanche the Spinach: In boiling water, blanch the spinach until soft (about 2 minutes). Puree the spinach in a blender, gradually adding skimmed milk to make a thick puree.
3. Saute Onions: In a small pan, heat the oil over medium flame. Sauté the onions until golden brown.
4. Cook with Ginger-Garlic: Add the ginger-garlic paste and fry for about 1 minute.
5. Add Tomatoes and Spices: Add the chopped tomato. Once it softens, add turmeric, paprika, and salt.
6. Mix with Spinach: Once the mixture is uniform, add the pureed spinach. Cook for about 2 minutes until well combined.
7. Serve the Palak Saag with rice.

name: ANDAY ALOO WITH ROTI
directions:
1. In a small skillet or pot, add the olive oil, potato slices, water, salt, cayenne pepper, black pepper, garlic, turmeric, and onions. Bring to a boil.
2. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 15-20 minutes until the potatoes are tender, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking. If needed, add a little more water if the potatoes are still hard after most of the water has evaporated.
3. Once the potatoes are tender and the water is mostly gone, add the raw egg. Mix well into the curry and cook over medium heat until the egg is fully cooked, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh parsley if desired.
5. Serve with one 7 inch roti.

name: BHINDI MASALA WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Prepare the Filling: Half-grind the garlic, ginger, and green chili together until roughly chopped. Make sure not to form a paste.
2. Mix the chopped garlic-ginger-chili mixture with salt, a bit of oil, coriander powder, mango powder, garam masala, and turmeric powder. Set aside this mixture for stuffing.
3. Prepare the Okra: Slit the okra lengthwise from the center, being careful not to cut them completely in half. Stuff the prepared spice mixture into the slits.
4. Cooking the Okra:
o Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a wide pan over medium heat. Add the sliced onions and sauté until they begin to soften.
o Gently add the stuffed okra to the pan. Stir lightly to avoid the masala from spilling out.
o Lower the heat to a simmer, cover the pan with a lid, and let the okra cook until they turn dark green and are almost tender.
5. Add Tomatoes: Once the okra is nearly cooked, add the chopped tomatoes. Cover again and cook until the tomatoes break down and blend with the spices.
6. Adjust Seasoning: Add salt to taste, stir gently, and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
7. Serve it with one 7 inch roti.

name: CHICKEN SHAWARMA
directions:
1. Marinate: In a large bowl or ziplock bag, combine the lemon juice, curry powder, olive oil, salt, cumin, and minced garlic. Add the chicken strips and toss well to coat evenly. Allow the chicken to marinate at room temperature for 20 minutes, or in the refrigerator for up to 2 hours.
2. Cooking: Grill the chicken strips or cook them in a pan over medium-high heat for about 4 minutes per side, until fully cooked and lightly golden.
3. Serve the chicken strips with warm pita bread or over a fresh lettuce salad.

name: PHALIAN WITH ROTI
directions:
1.	Heat Oil: In a skillet, heat canola oil over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and roast them for 2-3 minutes until they are fragrant.
2.	Sauté Onion: Add the chopped onion to the skillet and sauté on medium heat until golden brown.
3.	Add Beans & Spices: Stir in the frozen green beans, and add salt and chopped jalapeno to taste.
4.	Cook Beans: Increase the heat to high, cover the skillet with a lid, and let it cook for 5 minutes. Stir, reduce heat to medium, cover again, and cook for another 10 minutes or until the beans are tender. Add lemon juice if desired.
5.	Serve with one 7-inch roti.

name: DAAL PALAK WITH ROTI
directions:
1.	Cook Lentils: Soak the lentils if needed. Cook them in 1 cup of water until soft. Add more water if necessary to maintain a slightly watery consistency. Set aside.
2.	Prepare Spices: Heat a pan and add canola oil. When the oil is hot, add mustard seeds. Let them splutter, then add cumin seeds and chopped onion.
3.	Saute & Season: Fry the mixture for a few minutes. Add ginger and garlic paste. Stir well over low heat.
4.	Add Spinach & Spices: Mix in salt, coriander powder, and red pepper. Add the chopped spinach and cook on low heat until it softens.
5.	Combine with Lentils: Add the cooked lentils to the pan and let the mixture simmer for about 10 minutes until well blended. Adjust the consistency with water if needed—should be gravy-like, not too thick or watery.
6.	Garnish: Add fresh chopped coriander leaves before serving.
7.	Serve hot with one 7-inch roti.

name: DALIYA
directions:
1.	Boil Water and Cook Wheat: Bring 1 to 1.25 cups of water to a boil. Add the cracked wheat and reduce to a low simmer. Watch carefully to prevent it from boiling over.
2.	Add Spices and Sugar: Stir in the cinnamon, cardamom, and sugar. Let the mixture simmer until the cracked wheat thickens and is cooked to your preferred consistency.
3.	Finish with Milk: Once thickened, add 1/4 cup of milk, stir well, and let it cook for a few more minutes until everything is well combined and creamy.
4.	Serve warm, perfect for a cozy breakfast.

name: SAFAID LOBIYA WITH RICE
directions:
1.	Combine INGRIDIENTS: In a small saucepan, add 1/4 cup of cooked black-eyed peas and 1/4 cup of diced tomatoes with chiles.
2.	Add Seasoning: Stir in the curry powder, minced onion, and a pinch of red pepper flakes if desired.
3.	Cook: Bring the mixture to a simmer over medium heat. Cook for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4.	Serve with white basmati rice.

name: PALAK GOSHT WITH RICE
directions:
1.	Blanch the Spinach:
o	Boil a small pot of water and prepare a bowl with ice water.
o	Submerge 1/3 bunch of spinach in boiling water for 1 minute.
o	Immediately transfer to ice water for 1 minute. Drain and set aside.
2.	Prepare Spinach Mixture:
o	In a blender, blend blanched spinach, 1/3 green pepper, and 1 tbsp cilantro until smooth. Set aside.
3.	Make Onion Puree:
o	Blend 1/6 of an onion with 1 tbsp of water. Set aside.
4.	Make Tomato Puree:
o	Blend 1/3 tomato with 1 tbsp water. Set aside.
5.	Cook the Curry:
o	Heat 2 tsp of olive oil in a small pan on medium heat.
o	Add the whole spices and sauté for 30 seconds.
o	Add onion puree and sauté for 2 minutes.
o	Stir in 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste and sauté for 1 minute.
o	Add meat and sauté for another 2 minutes.
o	Mix in 1 tsp yogurt, stirring for 1 minute.
o	Add the powder spices and salt, sautéing for 2 minutes.
o	Stir in the tomato puree and cook for 2 minutes.
o	Add a bit of water if needed, and cook for 12 minutes until meat is tender.
6.	Add Spinach:
o	Add spinach mixture to the curry and simmer on low for 10 minutes.
7.	Tempering:
o	Heat 1/2 tsp olive oil in a small pan.
o	Fry 1 chopped garlic clove until golden, then add 1/2 dried red pepper for 30 seconds.
o	Pour this mixture over the cooked curry.
8.	Garnish:
o	Sprinkle with 1/2 tsp dried fenugreek leaves. 
9.	Serve hot with white basmati rice.

name: LAUKI KI SABZI WITH ROTI
directions:
1.	In a small skillet or pot, heat 1 tablespoon of oil on medium heat.
2.	Add the whole spices (cumin seeds, cinnamon stick, black peppercorns, cloves, green cardamom, black cardamom, and dried red pepper) and let them sizzle for about 5 seconds.
3.	Add the sliced onion and serrano pepper, and sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
4.	Add the ginger garlic paste and sauté for another 10 seconds.
5.	Add the chopped tomato and mix well.
6.	Sprinkle in the powdered spices (salt, coriander powder, red chili powder, and turmeric powder). Stir to combine.
7.	Add the diced bottle gourd (lauki) and mix for about 1 minute.
8.	Pour in 2 tablespoons of water, cover the pot, and cook on medium heat for 15 minutes or until the lauki is soft and fully cooked.
9.	Remove the lid, give it a good mix, and add a dash of lemon juice.
10.	Garnish with freshly chopped mint (optional).
11.	Serve hot with a fresh one 7-inch roti.

name: ACHAR CHICKEN WITH ROTI
directions:
1.	In a medium-sized pot, heat olive oil on medium heat.
2.	Add the diced onion and sauté until it becomes translucent.
3.	Add ginger garlic paste and sauté for another 10 seconds.
4.	Add chicken to the pot and sauté until it changes color from pink to white.
5.	Add the Shan Achari Masala and stir to coat the chicken.
6.	Mix in the cubed tomato, tomato paste, yogurt, and lemon juice, stirring well.
7.	Let it cook for 5-10 minutes until the tomatoes soften.
8.	Add the slitted serrano pepper and 3 tbsp of water. Stir well.
9.	Cover the pot and cook on medium-low heat for 7-10 minutes.
10.	Once the chicken is cooked, uncover the pot and add 3 tbsp of water. Stir for about 1 minute to combine.
11.	Garnish with finely chopped cilantro.
12.	Serve immediately with one hot 7-inch roti.

name: MUTTON KALEJI WITH ROTI
directions:
Soaking and Cleaning Kaleji:
1.	In a small bowl, combine goat liver, ½ cup of water, vinegar, and ¾ tsp of ginger garlic paste. Mix well and let it sit for 15 minutes.
2.	After 15 minutes, drain and set the liver aside.
Cooking Kaleji:
1.	In a small pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
2.	Add the whole spices (black cardamom, green cardamom, bay leaf, cloves, and black peppercorn) and sauté for about 10 seconds until fragrant.
3.	Add the sliced onion and sauté until golden brown.
4.	Add 1 tbsp of ginger garlic paste and mix well.
5.	Add the liver and continuously stir for 5 minutes until it turns dark brown.
6.	Add the powdered spices (excluding salt) and stir for an additional 5 minutes.
7.	Add yogurt and mix on medium-high heat for 4 minutes.
8.	Lower the heat to medium, add 2 tbsp of water, cover the pot, and cook for 10 minutes or until the liver is cooked through.
9.	Turn off the stove. Garnish with dried fenugreek leaves and salt.
10.	Serve hot with one 7-inch roti.

name: ALOO MATAR GAJAR WITH ROTI
directions:
Tomato and Green Pepper Puree:
1.	Blend together ½ medium tomato and ¼ small green pepper until smooth. Set aside.
Let's Make Aloo Matar Gajar!
1.	In a small pot, heat 1 tbsp of olive oil over medium heat.
2.	Add the whole spices (cumin seeds, black peppercorn, green cardamom, clove, black cardamom, and cinnamon stick) and sauté for 5-10 seconds until fragrant.
3.	Add the chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
4.	Add the ginger garlic paste and mix well.
5.	Add the cubed potatoes and chopped carrots, stirring for about 1 minute.
6.	Pour in the tomato and green pepper puree, letting it cook for 1-2 minutes.
7.	Add the powdered spices (red chili powder, turmeric, coriander, cumin, garam masala) and salt, mixing well.
8.	Add ¼ cup of water, bring it to a boil, then cover and cook for 5-10 minutes, or until the potatoes and carrots are tender and the water has mostly evaporated.
9.	Add the peas, cover, and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the peas are heated through.
10.	Turn off the stove. Garnish with chopped cilantro and dried fenugreek leaves.
11.	Serve hot with a warm 7-inch roti.

name: VEGETABLE PULAO
directions:
1.	Soak ⅓ cup of basmati rice for 25-30 minutes, then drain the water. Set aside.
2.	In a small pot, heat 2 tsp of olive oil over medium heat.
3.	Add the sliced onion and chopped green pepper. Sauté until the onion turns golden brown.
4.	Add the whole spices (bay leaf, cumin seeds, black peppercorn, cinnamon stick, green cardamom, and anise star) and stir well.
5.	Add ½ tsp of ginger garlic paste and sauté for 20 seconds until fragrant.
6.	Mix in the cubed potatoes and baby carrots. Stir to coat the vegetables in spices.
7.	Add a pinch of Garam Masala powder and ¼ tsp of salt. Mix well.
8.	Add ¾ cup of water, bring it to a boil, then cover the pot. Cook for about 10 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
9.	Uncover the pot, add the peas, and bring the mixture to a boil.
10.	Add the soaked and drained basmati rice along with 1 tbsp of additional water. Stir gently to combine.
11.	Increase the heat to high and bring to a boil for 3-4 minutes.
12.	Let half of the water evaporate, which should take about 4-5 minutes.
13.	Cover the pot, reduce the heat to medium, and cook for 8 minutes.
14.	Lower the heat to low and continue cooking for another 5 minutes.
15.	Turn off the stove and let the pulao sit covered for 5 minutes before serving.
16.	Serve hot with chutney and raita.

name: CHANAY CHAWAL
directions:
1.	In a small pot, heat 1 tbsp of olive oil over medium heat.
2.	Add the sliced onion and chopped green pepper. Sauté until the onion is golden brown.
3.	Add the whole spices (cumin seeds, cinnamon stick, black peppercorn, clove, and green cardamom) and sauté for about 10 seconds until fragrant.
4.	Stir in ½ tsp of ginger garlic paste and cook for 10 seconds.
5.	Add the chickpeas and sauté for another 15 seconds.
6.	Pour in ½ cup of water, add the salt and a pinch of Garam Masala powder, and mix gently.
7.	Cover the pot, turn the heat to high, and let it cook for 4 minutes.
8.	Reduce the heat to medium and cook for an additional 4-5 minutes.
9.	Lower the heat to low and cook for another 6 minutes.
10.	Turn off the stove, uncover the pot, and let the pulao rest for a couple of minutes before serving.
11.	Serve hot with a side of raita. Enjoy!

name: ALOO METHI WITH ROTI
directions:
•	Treating the Fresh Fenugreek Leaves:
1.	Pluck the leaves off the fenugreek stems and discard the stems.
2.	Rinse the leaves thoroughly with water.
3.	Place the leaves in a strainer over a bowl and mix in ¼ tsp of salt.
4.	Let the leaves sit for 20 minutes to allow some bitterness to drain out.
5.	Squeeze out excess water thoroughly from the fenugreek leaves. Set aside.
•	Cooking the Aloo Methi:
6.	In a small pot, heat 1 tbsp of olive oil over medium heat.
7.	Add the chopped onion and green pepper. Sauté until translucent.
8.	Add the whole spices (cumin seeds, black peppercorn, clove, green cardamom, and a small piece of round red chili pepper). Sauté for 10 seconds.
9.	Add the quartered potato pieces and sauté for 1 minute.
10.	Stir in ½ tsp of ginger garlic paste and ⅛ diced tomato. Mix well.
11.	Add the powdered spices (red chili flakes, red chili powder, turmeric, cumin, coriander, amchur) and salt. Mix well.
12.	Add ¼ cup of water, cover the pot, and let it cook on medium heat until the potatoes are tender, occasionally stirring. This should take about 10-12 minutes.
13.	Once the potatoes are fully cooked, add the treated fenugreek leaves. Mix well.
14.	Cover and let it cook for another 5-6 minutes on medium-low heat.
15.	Remove the lid, give it a final mix, and turn off the heat.
16.	Serve hot one 7-inch roti.

name: ALOO BHUJIA WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Prep: Chop the onion and tomatoes. Peel and cube the potato.
2. Cook:
o Heat the oil in a medium-sized skillet over medium heat.
o Add the chopped onion and sauté until lightly browned.
o Mix in salt, cayenne, turmeric, and cumin.
o Add the cubed potatoes, stirring occasionally for about 10 minutes.
3. Simmer:
o Stir in the tomatoes.
o Cover the pan and cook for an additional 10 minutes, or until the potatoes are soft.
4. Serve with one 7-inch roti.

name: MATAR CHAWAL
directions:
1. Put rice into a medium saucepan and add all INGRIDIENTS except peas and cilantro.
2. Bring to a boil, cover and lower to a simmer. Cook white rice for 18-20 minutes, brown rice for 45-50 minutes, or until all water has evaporated.
3. Add frozen peas to rice and allow to sit, covered, for 10 minutes.
4. Fluff rice with a fork and transfer to a serving bowl. Sprinkle with chopped cilantro and serve.
1. Put rice into a medium saucepan and add all ingredients except peas and cilantro.
2. Bring to a boil, cover and lower to a simmer. Cook white rice for 18-20 minutes, brown rice for 45-50 minutes, or until all water has evaporated.
3. Add frozen peas to rice and allow to sit, covered, for 10 minutes.
4. Fluff rice with a fork and transfer to a serving bowl. Sprinkle with chopped cilantro and serve.

name: ALOO TIKKI WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Boil potatoes in pressure cooker or in a pan until soft. Peel and mash them. Boil peas in boiling water for 5 minutes. Drain water and transfer them to a small bowl.
2. Take mashed potatoes in another bowl. Add boiled peas, 4 tablespoons breadcrumbs, cornstarch, grated ginger, coriander leaves, finely chopped green chilli, garam masala powder, red chilli powder, lemon juice, sugar, and salt.
3. Mix them to prepare smooth dough like mixture. Divide mixture into 12 equal portions and roll them into small size balls.
4. Take one ball and gently press it between your palms and make a round shaped 1/2-inch thick patty. Take 4 tablespoons breadcrumbs in a plate. Coat prepared pattie with breadcrumbs on all sides by rolling it in breadcrumbs filled plate.
5. Heat non-stick flat pan (tawa) or griddle to shallow fry patties. When pan or griddle is hot enough, drizzle 2-3 teaspoons oil over it. Put patties over oil and cook until bottom surface turn golden brown.
6. Flip each pattie up side down, drizzle some oil around its edge and cook until second side also turns golden brown,
7. Transfer prepared tikkis to a plate and serve with one 7-inch roti.

name: CHEESE OMELELTTE WITH BREAD
directions:
1. Whisk one whole egg with egg whites and season with salt and pepper.
2. Heat non stick skillet to medium low heat. Add butter and allow to melt.
3. When butter is melted, add egg and begin to swirl pan until egg covers the entire surface. Continue to swirl, making sure every part of egg begins to get cooked.
4. Add cheese to 1/2 of omelette. Fold the other side of the over and allow cheese to melt, about one minute.
5. When omelette is finished gently slide onto plate.
6. Serve with 2 slices of bread.

name: MUSHROOM CHEESE OMELETTE WITH BREAD
directions:
1. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat.
2. Cook chopped mushroom until soft. Remove from heat and set aside.
3. Mix whole egg and egg whites in a bowl; pour into skillet. Cook until egg starts to look dry. Add mushrooms and cheese.
4. Fold sides of egg toward the middle and wait for cheese to melt. 
5. Serve immediately with 2 slices of bread.

name: FRIED RICE
directions:
1. Cook rice: combine one part rice to around 2 parts water. Bring to boil, reduce heat to low and cover, cooking until rice is tender..
2. Heat the olive oil in a pan and add the cooked rice. Scramble the egg whites and whole egg together in a bowl and add to rice. Mix well.
3. Add your favorite mixed vegetables.
4. Cook until heated all the way through. Optional: add a little soy sauce if it's too dry, or some chicken to make it a full meal.

name: SCRAMBLED VEGETABLE EGG WITH BREAD
directions:
1. Scramble eggs with salt and pepper. set aside.
2. Heat pan to medium low heat. Add olive oil.
3. add all veggies to pan and saute lightly until almost soft.
4. add scrambled eggs to the pan and begin to stir eggs gently with a spatula until eggs begin to set. Remove from heat and enjoy.
5. Serve with 2 slices of bread.

name: SOFT BOILED EGGS WITH TOAST
directions:
1. Place eggs in a medium saucepan. Cover with cold water. Bring to the boil over high heat, stirring occasionally.
2. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer for 3 minutes. Remove pan from heat. Using a slotted spoon, transfer eggs to egg cups. Using a spoon, carefully remove tops from eggs.
3. Serve with 2 slices of bread.

name: Sweet and Sour Chicken with Rice
directions:
1. Prepare rice and put aside.
2. In a large bowl, mix the cornstarch, water, pepper, and egg whites. Add the chicken and toss until well coated.
3. In a large non-stick skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Season chicken strips and add to pan. Brown chicken and remove to plate. Add red and green peppers and onions and cook for 1 minute. Stir in pineapple chunks, juice, sugar, vinegar and chicken stock and bring to a simmer. Simmer until sauce begins to reduce. Stir in cornstarch mixture and bring liquid to a simmer. Stir in chicken strips and cook for 5 minutes. 
4. Serve over rice.

name: Chicken Breasts with Mushroom Cream Sauce
directions:
1. Season chicken with pepper and salt on both sides.
2. Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook, turning once or twice and adjusting the heat to prevent burning, until brown and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part registers 165 degrees F, 12 to 16 minutes. Transfer to a plate and tent with foil to keep warm.
3. Add shallot to the pan and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add mushrooms; cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 2 minutes.
4. Pour in broth and cook until reduced by half, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in cream and chives (or scallions); return to a simmer.
5. Return the chicken to the pan, turn to coat with sauce and cook until heated through, about 1 minute.

name: SPAGHETTI BOLOGNESE
directions:
1. Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook onion, carrot, celery, and garlic, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add ground beef. Cook, breaking up with a wooden spoon, for 6 to 8 minutes or until browned.
2. Add tomato paste, tomatoes, oregano, nutmeg, brown sugar, and 1/2 cup cold water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, uncovered, for 20 to 30 minutes or until thick. Season with salt and pepper.
3. Meanwhile, cook pasta in a large saucepan of boiling, salted water, following package directions, until tender. Drain.
4. Divide pasta among serving bowls. Spoon over sauce. Enjoy!

name: EGG CURRY WITH RICE
directions:
1. Bring eggs to room temperature. Boil a pot of water and reduce to a simmer. Add eggs and boil for 5-7 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon, cool slightly, and carefully shell, making sure not to break the egg. Cut in half and set aside.
2. In a pan heat 1 teaspoon oil. When the oil is hot, add 1 and 1/2 red onions chopped roughly, 2 ripe tomatoes, garlic, ginger, green chili pepper, and cilantro leaves.
3. Fry on medium flame until the onions have a nice char and are caramelized, and the tomatoes are mushy.
4. Let the onions and tomatoes cool completely. Then grind it to fine paste
5. In a different pan, heat 1 tablespoon oil. When the oil is hot, add remaing 1/2 finely chopped onions and fry until the onions are translucent.
6. Then add the ground paste from step 4.
7. Fry this paste in oil on low flame for 7 to 8 minutes until the oil separates from the mixture.
8. Now add peppercorn, turmeric powder, and 1 tablespoon water and sauté the mixture for a minute.
9. Add 1 and 1/2 cups of water to this masala and add salt to taste. Bring it to boil and simmer the gravy for 10 minutes or until it thickens to desired consistency.
10. Serving : Pour the curry in the serving bowl and arrange the boiled eggs on the top of the gravy and gently dip/submerge the eggs in the gravy.
11. Garnish with chopped cilantro leaves and 
12. Serve hot with rice. Enjoy!

name: MUTTON PAYE WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Prepare the Trotters: Wash the mutton trotters thoroughly.
2. Instant Pot Cooking:
o Turn on the Instant Pot to the sauté mode, add ½ cup of water, and bring it to a boil.
o Once boiling, add ¼ teaspoon red chili powder, ⅛ teaspoon turmeric powder, ⅙ teaspoon salt, and ½ tablespoon ginger garlic paste.
o Add the cleaned trotters to the Instant Pot, cover the lid, and pressure cook for 20 minutes. The trotters should be fully cooked.
3. Trotter Gravy:
o After cooking, release the pressure and check that the trotters are tender and cooked through.
4. Prepare the Curry:
o In a separate pot on medium heat, add 2 teaspoons of olive oil and heat it up.
o Add the whole spices (cumin seeds, green cardamom pods, black peppercorns, and cloves) and sauté for a few seconds until aromatic.
o Add the onion and sauté until it turns light brown.
o Mix in the yogurt and remaining ginger garlic paste (¼ tablespoon) and sauté until well incorporated.
o Add ⅓ teaspoon coriander powder and stir well.
5. Combine:
o Transfer the gravy and trotters from the Instant Pot to the stovetop pot. Mix well and sauté for 10 minutes over medium to low heat.
o Sprinkle a pinch of garam masala powder and stir well.
o Cover the pot and let it cook for another 5 minutes on low heat.
6. Garnish:
o Garnish with a small slice of green pepper, chopped cilantro, a few thin slices of ginger, and a dash of fresh lemon juice.
7. Serve:
o Enjoy the Goat Paya Curry hot with one 7-inch roti.

name: ALOO CHANAY WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Cook chickpeas
Soak 3 tablespoons of dried chickpeas for 8 hours. Drain and add 1 cup of water.
o Instant Pot: Cook on high pressure for 15 minutes, then allow the pressure to release naturally.
o Pressure Cooker: Cook on medium flame for about 3 whistles. Let the pressure release naturally.
o If using canned chickpeas, rinse and drain ½ cup.
2. Make onion tomato gravy
Heat ¾ teaspoon of oil in a deep pan. Add a bay leaf and a small slit green chili (optional). Roughly chop ½ onion and blend into a smooth puree. Add to the pan and sauté for a couple of minutes.
Add ½ teaspoon of ginger-garlic paste and sauté for 5 to 10 minutes.
Roughly chop ½ tomato and puree it. Add to the pan and stir for 5 to 10 minutes until thick.
3. Cook potatoes with spices
Peel ¼ large potato and dice into 1-inch cubes. Add to the pot and stir.
Add ¼ teaspoon chili powder, ¼ teaspoon Kashmiri chili powder, ¼ teaspoon coriander powder, ⅛ teaspoon pepper, ⅛ teaspoon cumin, a pinch of garam masala, and ¼ teaspoon salt.
Add 2 tablespoons of water (from cooked chickpeas or plain water) and cook covered for 10 minutes or until the potatoes are cooked.
4. Make chana puree
Take 1 tablespoon of the cooked chickpeas and blend with 2 tablespoons of water until smooth.
5. Add chana to the curry
Add the rest of the cooked chickpeas and the chana puree to the curry. Mix well. Simmer until you get the desired consistency.
Garnish with ½ tablespoon chopped coriander leaves. Drizzle ¾ teaspoon lemon juice.
6.  Serve with one 7-inch roti.

name: MUTTON MASALA WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Prepare Mutton
Trim fat, rinse, and chop the mutton into bite-size pieces.
o Mutton: 175 grams (6.25 oz) bone-in or 125 grams (4.5 oz) boneless.
2. Pressure Cook
In a pressure cooker, add mutton, ¼ teaspoon chili powder, ¼ teaspoon coriander powder, ⅛ teaspoon turmeric, ⅛ teaspoon ground cumin, and ¼ teaspoon salt. Add ½ chopped onion, ½ chopped tomato, and ½ teaspoon ginger garlic paste.
Cook on medium heat after the first whistle for about 10 minutes, or until the mutton is tender.
Turn off the heat and allow the pressure to release naturally.
3. Roast Curry Leaves
In a small pan, heat ¼ teaspoon of oil, and roast ½ sprig of curry leaves until crisp and aromatic. Set aside.
4. Finish Cooking
In the same pan, heat the remaining ½ teaspoon of oil. Add a bay leaf and transfer the contents from the pressure cooker to the pan.
Add ⅜ teaspoon pepper and ⅛ teaspoon garam masala. Cook for 5-10 minutes until the gravy thickens and browns. The meat should be tender and fall off the bone easily.
5. Serve
Transfer to a serving bowl, garnish with fresh chopped coriander and roasted curry leaves. 
6. Serve with one 7-inch roti.

name: TANDOORI CHICKEN TIKKA WRAPS
directions:
1. Prepare the Chicken Tikka
Use 125 grams of pre-cooked chicken tikka (you can marinate and cook your own or use store-bought/pre-marinated chicken). Ensure it's in small chunks.
2. Sauté Vegetables
In a small pan, heat ¾ teaspoon of olive oil. Add ½ thinly sliced onion and ½ thinly sliced bell pepper. Sauté over medium-low heat until softened, about 5-7 minutes. Add ⅛ teaspoon chili powder, ⅛ teaspoon chaat masala, and salt. Stir for a couple more minutes until aromatic. Set aside.
3. Make the Yogurt Sauce
In a small bowl, mix 2 tablespoons of yogurt with ¼ teaspoon lime juice, a pinch of chaat masala, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
4. Assemble the Wrap
Warm 2 parathas/tortillas (either on a stovetop or microwave). Spread 1 tablespoon of mint chutney on each paratha. Layer with shredded lettuce, sautéed onions, bell peppers, and chunks of chicken tikka.
Drizzle with yogurt sauce and top with fresh chopped coriander leaves.
Roll up tightly and serve warm.

name: SESAME CHICKEN WITH RICE
directions:
1. Tenderize Chicken
Clean and cut the chicken breast into 1-1/2 inch cubes. Mix with ⅔ teaspoon of baking soda and let it sit for 20 minutes.
Rinse the chicken cubes thoroughly and pat them dry with a paper towel.
2. Marinate the Chicken
Whisk together ½ tablespoon soy sauce, ⅙ tablespoon oyster sauce, ⅓ tablespoon rice vinegar, ⅔ teaspoon sesame oil, ⅓ teaspoon chili flakes, ⅓ teaspoon brown sugar, ⅙ teaspoon pepper, and a pinch of salt until the solids dissolve.
Mix the marinade with the chicken and set aside for 10 minutes.
3. Sweet and Spicy Chicken Stir-fry
In a wok, heat ⅔ tablespoon of peanut oil. Add 1-2 finely chopped garlic cloves and stir-fry until fragrant (be careful not to brown them).
Add the marinated chicken (along with any leftover marinade) to the pan and stir-fry on high heat for 5 minutes.
Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon of water, stir-fry for an additional 5 minutes, then repeat with another tablespoon of water for a final 5 minutes of stir-frying.
Turn off the heat.
4. Garnish and Serve
Sprinkle toasted sesame seeds and chopped green onions or parsley over the dish. Serve hot over a bed of white rice.

name: HARYALI CHICKEN WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Prepare the Chicken
Clean and remove the skin from the chicken drumsticks. Make a few diagonal slashes on the flesh to allow the marinade to penetrate better.
2. Make the Marinade
In a food processor or blender, blend the mint leaves, yogurt, shallot, garlic, ginger, green chili, lemon juice, lemon zest, and sea salt until smooth.
3. Marinate the Chicken
Coat the drumsticks with the marinade, ensuring they are evenly covered. Let the chicken marinate for at least 30 minutes. For best results, marinate overnight in the refrigerator.
4. Bake the Chicken
Preheat the oven to 230°C (450°F). Line a baking tray with parchment paper. Arrange the drumsticks on the tray, making sure they don’t touch.
Drizzle ½ tablespoon of olive oil over the chicken. Bake for 30 minutes, flipping the drumsticks after 15-20 minutes.
The chicken should reach an internal temperature of 75°C (165°F). If you don’t have a thermometer, cut into the thickest part of the drumstick to check for doneness—the meat should not be pink. If needed, cook for an additional 5 minutes.
5. Serve
Let the chicken rest for a few minutes before serving. 
6. Enjoy it with one 7-inch roti and chutney or ketchup.

name: TANDORI CHICKEN WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Prepare the Marinade
In a prep bowl, mix all the spices together. Add the yogurt, lemon juice, and ginger-garlic paste to the spices. Mix until well combined.
2. Marinate the Chicken
Coat the chicken leg quarter with the marinade, ensuring it is evenly covered. Marinate in the refrigerator for a minimum of 2 hours (overnight is best).
3. Preheat the Oven
Preheat your oven to 230°C (446°F). Line a baking pan with parchment paper.
4. Roast the Chicken
Place the marinated chicken leg on the prepared baking pan. Set the oven to "roast" mode. Roast the chicken for 12-15 minutes, then flip it and baste with the juices from the pan. Roast for another 12-15 minutes.
5. Broil the Chicken
Set the oven to "broil" mode. Baste the chicken with a small amount of butter and broil for about 10 minutes, flipping once after 5 minutes, until it is browned and cooked through. The internal temperature should reach 75°C (165°F).
6. Serve
Let the chicken rest for 5 minutes before serving. Garnish with shredded carrot and sliced onion. 
7. Serve hot with a side of green chutney if desired and one 7-inch roti.

name: Savory Mashed Pumpkin (With Coconut)
directions:
1. Boil the Pumpkin
Peel and chop the pumpkin into 1-inch cubes. In a medium pot, bring water to a boil, then add the pumpkin cubes. Cook until they are tender but not mushy, about 10-12 minutes. Drain and set aside.
2. Sauté the Aromatics
Heat the vegetable oil in a small pan over medium heat. Add the mustard and fennel seeds. When they start to splutter, add the curry leaves, minced garlic, and chopped onion. Sauté until the onions are soft and translucent.
3. Combine Ingredients
Add the cooked pumpkin cubes, grated carrot, chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Stir gently on low heat for about 5-7 minutes until everything is well combined.
4. Serve
Transfer to a serving dish and garnish with desiccated coconut. 
5. Serve as a side dish with rice.

name: NARGISI KOFTAY WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Prepare the Kofta:
o In a non-stick pan, heat a tiny bit of oil (or use a non-stick surface).
o Add the ground beef, besan, chopped green chilies, garlic, red chili powder, turmeric, garam masala (or lamb masala), cumin seeds, black pepper, chopped onion, chopped ginger, and salt.
o Sauté until everything is well combined and cooked (about 20 minutes). Ensure the mixture is dry.
o Transfer the mixture to a blender or food processor and blend until smooth.
o Coat a hard-boiled egg with this mixture. Dip the coated egg in the beaten egg and deep fry until golden brown. Set aside.
2. Prepare the Curry:
o In a small pot, heat the ghee.
o Sauté the onions until golden brown.
o Add the tomato puree, red chili powder, turmeric, garam masala (or lamb masala), and salt. Mix well.
o Add a small amount of water if needed and cook on low heat for about 10 minutes.
o Add the prepared kofta to the curry. Simmer gently for another 5 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.
3. Serve:
o Garnish with fresh cilantro if desired. 
o Serve hot with one 7-inch rice.

name: BEEF PAYE WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Preparation of Trotters:
o Ensure the beef trotters are thoroughly washed.
o In the Instant Pot, set it to sauté mode, and bring ½ cup of water to a boil.
o Add red chili powder, turmeric powder, salt, mace (javitri), and coriander powder. Stir well.
o Add the trotters to the water, cover the lid, and set to Pressure Cook mode for 40 minutes (time may vary based on the trotters' quality).
o Once done, carefully vent out the steam and set aside the cooked trotters and gravy.
2. Preparing the Curry:
o In a small pot over medium heat, add 1 teaspoon of olive oil.
o When the oil is hot, add the cumin seeds, green cardamom, black peppercorn, and clove. Sauté briefly until aromatic.
o Add the sliced onion and sauté until golden brown.
o Stir in ¾ tablespoon of ginger garlic paste and mix well.
o Add the ½ teaspoon of yogurt and combine.
o Pour the gravy and trotters from the Instant Pot into the pot. Mix well and let it cook for 10 minutes on medium-low heat.
o Add a tiny pinch of garam masala and stir well.
o Cover and cook for an additional 5 minutes on low heat.
3. Garnish and Serve:
o Squeeze a few drops of fresh lemon juice over the curry.
o Garnish with finely chopped cilantro, green chili, and julienned ginger.
o Serve hot with one 7-inch roti.

name: BEEF MASALA CURRY WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Marination:
o In a small bowl, mix together the beef, yogurt, lemon juice, ginger garlic paste, and a pinch of salt.
o Let the mixture marinate for 10 minutes.
o Add 2 teaspoons of water to the mixture.
2. Pressure Cooking:
o If using an Instant Pot, transfer the marinated beef mixture to the Instant Pot.
o Seal and cook on Pressure Cook mode for 11 minutes.
o Vent the steam out and set the cooked beef mixture aside.
3. Curry Preparation:
o In a small pan or wok, on medium heat, dry roast the bay leaf, black cardamom, green cardamom, black peppercorn, cinnamon, and clove for a few seconds.
o Add 1 teaspoon of olive oil to the wok and heat it up.
o Add the sliced onion and sauté until golden brown.
o Stir in the ginger garlic paste and sauté for 30 seconds.
o Add the red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, salt, and cumin powder. Mix well.
o Transfer the cooked beef mixture from the Instant Pot to the wok and mix everything together.
4. Tomato Puree:
o Blend ½ a small tomato and a small slice of green pepper in a blender until smooth.
o Add the tomato puree and ⅛ teaspoon of tomato paste to the curry mixture.
o Cover the pan and let it simmer on low heat for 5 minutes.
5. Finishing Touches:
o Sprinkle a tiny pinch of garam masala over the curry.
o Garnish with finely chopped cilantro.
o Serve hot with one 7-inch roti.

name: ARVI GOSHT WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Prepare the Taro Root:
o Peel the skin off the taro root and make a cross on both the top and bottom.
o Cut the taro root into halves.
2. Initial Frying:
o Turn on the Instant Pot on Sauté mode. Add 2 teaspoons of olive oil and let it heat.
o Add the halved taro roots and fry for 2-3 minutes, stirring continuously. Remove and set aside.
3. Sauté the Base:
o In the same oil, add the thinly sliced onion and sauté until light brown.
o Add the ginger garlic paste and sauté for 30 seconds.
4. Add Spices:
o Add the cumin seeds, nigella seeds, black peppercorn, black cardamom, green cardamom, and clove. Mix well.
o Add the mutton and sauté for 2-3 minutes, stirring continuously.
o Add red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
5. Pressure Cooking the Meat:
o Pour 2-3 tablespoons of water into the Instant Pot. Mix everything well.
o Close the Instant Pot lid, set it to Pressure Cook mode for 20 minutes.
o Allow the Instant Pot to vent naturally.
6. Final Cooking:
o Add the fried taro roots to the meat mixture, and mix well.
o Pressure cook again for 2 minutes. Let the Instant Pot vent.
7. Finishing Touches:
o Mix well, then add the yogurt. Turn the Instant Pot to Sauté mode and let it cook uncovered for 5 minutes.
o Turn off the Instant Pot.
8. Garnish:
o Squeeze a few drops of lemon juice over the dish and garnish with finely chopped cilantro.
o Serve hot with one 7-inch roti.

name: TURAI KI SABZI WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Preparation:
o Peel and cut the ridge gourd into small pieces.
o Slice the onion thinly and cut the green chili lengthwise, removing the seeds.
2. Tempering (Tadka):
o In a heavy-bottomed pan or kadai, heat 1 teaspoon of oil over medium flame.
o Once the oil is hot, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dry red chili, and curry leaves. Fry until the curry leaves change color.
3. Cooking:
o Add the sliced onions to the pan and sauté until they become translucent.
o Add the ridge gourd pieces, red chili powder, turmeric powder, salt, and green chili to the pan. Stir gently to combine all the ingredients.
o Cover with a lid and cook on low flame until all the water released from the ridge gourd evaporates and the vegetable is tender (about 15-20 minutes).
4. Garnish:
o Once done, garnish with freshly chopped coriander leaves.
o Serve with one 7-inch roti.

name: KARELAY QEEMA WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Prepare the Bitter Melon:
o Slice the bitter melon and place it in a bowl.
o Sprinkle with ½ tsp salt and ¼ tsp turmeric powder. Massage and let rest for 15 minutes.
o Rinse the bitter melon under water and squeeze out all the excess moisture.
o Bring water to a boil in a pot, then add the bitter melon and cook for 2 minutes. Drain.
o Heat 1 tsp olive oil in a frying pan, and fry the bitter melon pieces for 5-7 minutes until lightly browned. Set aside.
2. Prepare the Keema:
o Heat 1 tsp olive oil in a pot over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until golden brown.
o Add the ginger garlic paste, then the whole spices (cloves, cardamom, and black peppercorns). Stir for a minute.
o Add the ground beef, breaking it up as it cooks. Once browned, mix in the yogurt and cook for another 2 minutes.
o Add the powdered spices (red chili powder, chili flakes, turmeric, salt, coriander powder, cumin powder), fennel powder, carrom seeds, and green pepper. Stir to combine.
o Add the fried bitter melon pieces to the mixture, and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes on medium-low.
o Stir in ½ tsp lemon juice and 1 tbsp water. Cover and simmer on low for 5 minutes.
3. Garnish and Serve:
o Garnish with fresh cilantro and a squeeze of lemon juice if desired.
o Serve hot with one 7-inch roti.

name: TINDAY GOSHT WITH RICE
directions:
1. Prepare the Onion Paste:
o Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and fry until browned. Remove the onion and grind it into a paste.
2. Cook the Spices:
o In the same pot, add turmeric, coriander powder, chili powder, cloves, black pepper, black cardamom, ginger paste, garlic paste, and salt. Fry the mixture with a little water (about 2 tbsp) until it dries out.
3. Cook the Mutton:
o Add the mutton to the spice mixture and cook until the water evaporates, and the meat is lightly browned.
4. Add Water and Cook:
o Add about ¾ cup of water to the pot. Cover and cook the meat until it becomes tender (about 30 minutes, depending on the quality of the mutton).
5. Add Tinday:
o Once the mutton is nearly done, add the tinday (round gourds) and cook until they are tender and the gravy thickens to your desired consistency.
6. Final Touch:
o Sprinkle garam masala powder on top and garnish with fresh mint leaves.
7. Serve:
o Serve with rice.

name: ALOO GOSHT WITH RICE
directions:
1. Fry the Onion:
o In a medium pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add the onion and fry until light brown. Remove the onion and place it on a paper towel to pat dry. Once cooled, grind it into a paste.
2. Cook the Spices:
o In the same pot, add turmeric, coriander powder, chili powder, ginger paste, garlic paste, and salt. Add about 2 tbsp of water to the pot and cook until most of the water has evaporated.
3. Cook the Mutton:
o Add the mutton and ground onion paste to the pot. Cook until the water evaporates again and the meat is lightly browned.
4. Add Water and Simmer:
o Add 1½ cups of water to the pot, cover, and let the meat cook until tender (about 1-1½ hours).
5. Add Potatoes:
o Once the meat is tender, add the potatoes and cook until the potatoes are soft and tender.
6. Finish the Gravy:
o Cook on low heat until the oil starts to separate and the gravy thickens to your liking.
7. Garnish:
o Garnish with fresh chopped coriander/cilantro, green chilies, and a squeeze of lime juice.
8. Serve:
o Serve hot with rice.

name: SHALJAM GOSHT WITH RICE
directions:
1. Fry the Onion:
o In a medium pot, heat oil and fry the onion until golden brown.
2. Cook the Spices and Tomatoes:
o Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, chili powder, and cumin seeds to the pot with the fried onion. Stir well.
o Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and the water evaporates.
3. Cook the Meat:
o Add the mutton to the pot and cook, stirring occasionally, until the water evaporates.
4. Simmer:
o Add 1½ cups of water, cover the pot, and cook until the meat is tender (approximately 1 hour).
5. Add Shaljam:
o Once the meat is almost done, add the chopped shaljam (turnip). Cook until the shaljam is tender and the water reduces.
6. Finish:
o Garnish with fresh coriander, sliced green chilies, and ginger slices.
o Sprinkle with garam masala powder.
7. Serve:
o Serve hot with rice.

name: CHANAY KI DAAL GOSHT WITH RICE
directions:
1. Fry the Onion:
o Heat oil in a medium pot. Add the chopped onion and fry until it starts turning brown.
2. Cook the Spices and Meat:
o Add turmeric powder, chili powder, salt, and the meat (mutton or chicken). Cook until the water evaporates.
3. Add Daal:
o Add the presoaked daal (chana) and 2 cups of water. Cover the pot and cook on low heat until both the meat and daal are tender (approximately 1.5 hours for mutton, less time for chicken).
4. Add Ginger and Garam Masala:
o Once the meat and daal are tender, add ginger paste and garam masala. Stir and cook for another 5 minutes.
5. Prepare the Tarka (Bhagar):
o In a small pan, fry a few slices of onion in a little oil until brown. Add the fried onions with the hot oil to the dish.
6. Garnish and Serve:
o Garnish the dish with fresh coriander, chopped green chilies, and a squeeze of lemon juice.
7. Serve:
o Serve hot with rice.

name: BHINDI GOSHT WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Fry the Onion:
o Heat the oil in a pot and fry the chopped onion on a low flame until it becomes brown. Remove from the oil and spread it on a plate to cool and dry out.
2. Cook the Spices:
o In the same oil, add chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and 2 tbsp of water. Cook over medium heat, stirring well.
3. Add the Meat:
o Add the mutton to the pot and stir until the water from the meat has evaporated.
4. Add Water and Cook:
o Pour 1 cup of water into the pot, cover, and cook on low heat until the meat tenderizes (about 1 hour for mutton).
5. Add Fried Onion:
o Once the water has reduced by half, crush the fried onion and add it to the pot.
6. Add Bhindi and Cook:
o Add the bhindi (okra) to the pot and cook until the bhindi is tender and the gravy has a moderate consistency.
7. Add Garam Masala:
o Sprinkle the garam masala into the pot and stir to combine.
8. Serve:
o Serve the Bhindi Gosht hot with one 7-inch roti.

name: LAHORI FRIED FISH
directions:
1. Prep the Fish:
o In a bowl of water, add a few tablespoons of salt and soak the fish for 20 minutes.
o Rinse the fish well in clean water and pat dry.
2. Marinate the Fish:
o Mix tamarind with 1/4 cup of water, mash into a slurry, and strain into a mixing bowl.
o In the tamarind water, add all the remaining ingredients (except the fish). Stir well to combine.
o Toss the fish in the marinade, ensuring each piece is coated evenly. Let it marinate for 30 minutes.
3. Fry the Fish:
o Heat vegetable oil in a wok or deep fryer to 300°F (150°C), ensuring there's enough oil to cover the fish.
o Fry the fish in batches (3-4 pieces at a time) for 3-4 minutes, gently flipping every 2 minutes, until golden brown and crispy.
4. Serve:
o Serve the Lahori Fried Fish hot with mint chutney, chat masala, and a squeeze of lemon for added flavor.

name: CLASSIC BREAKFAST
directions:
Puri:
1. Mix maida and aata, and knead into a dough using 2 tsp of oil and about 1/4 cup of water.
2. Roll the dough into small, flat puris.
3. Deep fry the puris in hot oil until golden brown.
Aaloo Bhujiya:
1. Cut the potato into small cubes.
2. In a pan, add potatoes, spices, and 1/4 cup of water. Cook on low heat.
3. Once potatoes are soft, mash them lightly.
Chanay:
1. In a pot, add boiled chanay, 1/4 cup of water, and the spices.
2. Cook until the chanay is tender and mash lightly.
3. Continue cooking until bubbles form, then remove from heat.
Halva:
1. Heat ghee in a pot and add suji along with cardamom seeds. Fry on low heat while stirring constantly until slightly brown.
2. Mix sugar with 1/4 cup of water to make syrup. Add food color if desired.
3. Pour the syrup into the suji and cook on low heat until it reaches the desired consistency.
Serving:
Serve the puris with halva, aaloo bhujiya, chanay, and enjoy with achaar or yogurt.

name: BRAIN MASALA WITH ROTI
directions:
1. Boil the Brain:
o Boil both cow and goat brain with 1/6 tsp of salt and 1/8 tsp of turmeric until firm.
o Drain, clean, de-vein, and cut the brain into coarse pieces.
2. Sauté the Onion:
o Heat oil in a pot and sauté the onion until light brown.
